sub_title: Global Programme Director, Save the Children Netherlands
summary:
I am a competent senior manager with 21+ years of experience in Europe, Africa, the Middle East and Asia. Throughout my career I have worked with international NGOs and the UN on issues related to conflict and peace, humanitarian assistance, and development. I thrive in the most complex of contexts and when I am offered the opportunity to build a diverse team, network, influence and mobilise resources. I believe the impact and quality of our work across the triple nexus of development, humanitarian and peacebuilding should always be what drives us, no matter the circumstance.  

My current position is that of Global Programme Director with Save the Children in The Hague, The Netherlands where I live with my family. My previous three posts were Chief of Party for the Syria Resilience Consortium (CARE, IRC, NRC, DRC, HI, Mercy Corps), Director of Regional Change for CARE in West Africa and Peacebuilding Director for CARE.

Responsibilities:
•	In consultation with the Steering Committee (SC) consisting of representatives of the 6 organisations, setting up of governance model for the consortium, which includes area coordination teams in 5 different countries, technical teams, the programme coordination unit (PCU) and the SC itself.

•	Leadership to the PCU, and Area Coordination. The PCU is mandated to coordinate the SRC members at Whole of Syria Level and liaise with the various Grant Holders of the Consortium on behalf of the SC, in order to facilitate: a) Impactful, coherent and efficient programming; b) Enhanced Monitoring, Evaluation, Accountability & Learning (MEAL) and Knowledge Management; and c) Impactful Communication, Representation and Advocacy.
